column1: Dermatomyositis is a muscle disease that involves inflammation and a skin rash.
Experts think it may be due to a viral infection of the muscles or a problem with the body's immune system.
It may also occur in people who have cancer in the abdomen, lung, or other parts of the body.
The rash may appear on your face, knuckles, neck, shoulders, upper chest, and back.
The disease is treated with anti-inflammatory medicines called corticosteroids.
You may also take drugs to suppress the immune system such as methotrexate, azathioprine, and hydroxychloroquine to treat the skin rash.
Symptoms may go away completely in some people, such as children.
